subject: Re: [junit] running test methods in order
msgSnippet: An excellent reminder. So said  Shane Celis  on  2003-01-29 -------------------- ... particular ... http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/ J. B. Rainsberger,
messageBody:
An excellent reminder.

So said Shane Celis on 2003-01-29 --------------------

>Your test is this:
>
>void testDatabase() {
> empty();
> insert();
> try {
> insert();
> fail();
> } catch (Exception e) { }
>}
>
>Not every method is a test.
>
>-shane
>
>On Wednesday, January 29, 2003, at 05:10 AM, belingueres
><gaby@...> wrote:
>
>> Hi,
>>
>> I need to test a simple insertion of a tuple into a data base table.
>>
>> First I set the table empty, then I test that an specific tuple is
>> correctly inserted.
>> Then, I try to insert the same tuple again, which would result in an
>> exception, since its primary key is duplicated.
>>
>> Those tow tests I did it in two different testXXX() methods in the
>> TestCase: testInsert() and testDuplicated()
>>
>> The thing is that JUnit runs first the testDuplicated() method and
>> then the testInsert(), so the two tests fails!
>>
>> How can I assure myself that the two test methods run in a
particular
>> order?
>>
>> Is this a good testing practice?
>>
>> Thanks in advance,
>
>
>
>To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
>junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
